options.text: Because it helps to develop bilateral symmetry.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it helps to develop radial symmetry.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it provides strong evidence of evolutionary relationships and helps to reconstruct the tree of life.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it helps to develop streamlined fins.

title: What is the World Wide Web?

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary difference between the World Wide Web and the Internet?

options.label: A
options.text: The World Wide Web is a service provided by the Internet.

options.label: B
options.text: The Internet is simply the way computers connect to each other in order to share information.

options.label: C
options.text: The World Wide Web is a physical network of computers.

options.label: D
options.text: The Internet is a virtual city where people communicate with each other.

multiple-choice.question: How do web servers store and share information?

options.label: A
options.text: They use email to send information to other computers.

options.label: B
options.text: They use file transfer to share information with other computers.

options.label: C
options.text: They store information and share it through the World Wide Web.

options.label: D
options.text: They use conferencing to share information with other computers.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of a website address?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide a physical address for a website.

options.label: B
options.text: To give a unique name to a website.

options.label: C
options.text: To let users get where they want to go on the World Wide Web.

options.label: D
options.text: To provide a way for users to pay for a website.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of web browsers in accessing websites?

options.label: A
options.text: They create a graphic interface for users to interact with websites.

options.label: B
options.text: They store information on websites for users to access.

options.label: C
options.text: They provide a way for users to pay for websites.

options.label: D
options.text: They translate web languages into words, graphics, and videos.

multiple-choice.question: Who owns the World Wide Web?

options.label: A
options.text: Individuals who set up websites.

options.label: B
options.text: Companies that provide Internet services.

options.label: C
options.text: Utility companies that provide crucial services.

options.label: D
options.text: No one owns the Web; it belongs to all of us.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary advantage of the World Wide Web over traditional information consumption?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows users to access information in a linear fashion.

options.label: B
options.text: It provides a way for users to pay for information.

options.label: C
options.text: It allows users to access information in a non-linear fashion, mirroring the natural arrangement of thoughts.

options.label: D
options.text: It provides a way for users to communicate with each other in real-time.

multiple-choice.question: Who is credited with creating the World Wide Web?

options.label: A
options.text: Tim Berners-Lee, the father of the World Wide Web.

options.label: B
options.text: Steve Jobs, the co-founder of Apple.

options.label: C
options.text: Bill Gates, the co-founder of Microsoft.

options.label: D
options.text: Mark Zuckerberg, the co-founder of Facebook.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of hyperlinks in the World Wide Web?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide a way for users to pay for websites.

options.label: B
options.text: To allow users to access information in a linear fashion.

options.label: C
options.text: To link several pages within a website or redirect users to other websites.

options.label: D
options.text: To provide a way for users to communicate with each other in real-time.

multiple-choice.question: How does the World Wide Web reflect the natural arrangement of thoughts?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows users to access information in a linear fashion.

options.label: B
options.text: It provides a way for users to pay for information.

options.label: C
options.text: It allows users to access information in a non-linear fashion, mirroring the natural arrangement of thoughts.

options.label: D
options.text: It provides a way for users to communicate with each other in real-time.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the World Wide Web in connecting minds across boundaries?

options.label: A
options.text: It provides a way for users to pay for information.

options.label: B
options.text: It allows users to access information in a linear fashion.

options.label: C
options.text: It connects minds across all boundaries, including ethnicity, gender, age, time, and space.

options.label: D
options.text: It provides a way for users to communicate with each other in real-time.
